title: Red + Yellow Garnets
description: Is it worth me making a page for them and all the silly named dusts they can make? I mean on the electrolyzer page there is the recipes for processing the silly dusts but an exclusive page to see all of them at once would be better, right?

replies.body: That would probably be worthwhile, listing the uses for the Garnets.  They're rather odd materials, even by GregTech complexity standards.

Maybe add a gems page? Red and Yellow Garnets are pretty unique in their weirdness, but they also have enough commonalities with the other gems. You could add a subsection dedicated to them in that page, but I don't know if it's worth it to have one just for them.

Do we have a subdirectory for materials? I know we have ores, but nothing on materials like ingots and gems. Perhaps we make something like that, a page for all of the materials (ingots, dusts, gems). They could be grouped, so iron dusts with iron ingots for example.
Gems yes, but have you seen how many dusts there are? Materials is a good idea in theory, but in practice it could take a VERY long time to make.

A lot of dusts are just ground ingots, and the rest shouldn't take TOO long...
Just slap a WIP on it :P
Sort of like my Config Guide page... that I started 6 months ago and never finished... :P
The config guide was always next on my fix the page list, but the list kept growing since someone kept adding new things.

I think that a materials list should be good. I think that subdividing by Element is best.
Hydrogen, Helium, Lithium, Berylium, Carbon, Nitrogen, Oxygen, Fluorine, Sodium, Magnesium, Aluminium, Silicon, Phosphorus, Sulfur, Chlorine, Potassium, Calcium, Titanium...

Every element page has information around it... like sources, uses and chemical compounds that has it (gems, alloys, useful substances)
I was thinking less a page for each, and more just one page. Easier navigation on the sidebar. We could do multiple pages though.

Landing page for all materials with links to pages for each material?
(That's actually something I wanted to have for the Bronze age Steam machinery, since there are some rules that all of them follow.)
How about a periodic table layout for the elements :P
